[url=http://www.itainayarit.org.mx/guccibags.html]gucci bags[/url] Folks who left qualities because of Hurricane Georges might not exactly want to go back. Across the Gulf Coast in Louisiana and Ms, evacuees are finding their homes ripped apart and filled with sewage and seaweed. One particular man says he's so "discombobulated," he doesn't know which in turn way is up.Reports About Animals Yet things are a bit more serious for those cleaning up after Hurricane Georges just far east of Pascagoula, Miss. They have to watch out for floating alligators. Staff at the Gulf Seacoast Gator Ranch say regarding 30 of the pets floated over a wall as the storm overloaded the area. The farm's masters say they were trying to stop the gators from traversing Highway 90, yet there isn't much they could do until the water goes down. Others say they're too busy helping people stranded in their homes throughout the highway. One Pascagoula gentleman says most people are not appearing too worried about having the beasts on the free right now.
